title: CI Job not starting
description: i think we need to change CI jobs to use github runner not local runner

implementationPlan.description: Fix release.yml job-level secrets access that causes workflow file parse failure. Line 84 uses `if: secrets.JETBRAINS_MARKETPLACE_TOKEN != ''` at the JOB level, but `secrets` context is not resolvable at job-level `if` conditions during workflow parsing, causing the entire workflow to fail to load (0 jobs, 0s, 'workflow file issue'). Fix by removing the job-level `if` and instead adding `if: ${{ env.PUBLISH_TOKEN != '' }}` to the actual publish step (line 108-113), which already sets the env var. This way the job always runs but the publish step is skipped when the secret is missing. Also add proper error handling with `continue-on-error: true` on the step.
implementationPlan.note: Removed the job-level secret-based `if` from `publish-plugin` and moved conditional gating to the publish step via `if: ${{ env.PUBLISH_TOKEN != '' }}` while keeping `continue-on-error: true`. This avoids workflow parse-time context issues and allows the workflow/job to load even when the secret is unset.

implementationPlan.description: Test the fix by validating the workflow YAML syntax locally using `actionlint` or by verifying GitHub Actions can parse the corrected file. Confirm the workflow name renders as 'Release' (not the raw file path) in the GitHub Actions UI, which indicates successful parsing.
implementationPlan.note: Validated workflow syntax locally by parsing `.github/workflows/release.yml` with Python/PyYAML (success: name=Release, jobs=build-and-release,publish-plugin). Also ran a structural check confirming no job-level `if` conditions reference `secrets.*`. `actionlint` was not installed in this environment, so validation used YAML parse + targeted semantic guard checks.
